title: Server Issues
body: My friend and I are having weird connection issues to the riot servers right now. At first we thought it was our connection but that isn't the case since everything else on our network works perfectly fine and a speed test confirmed that. We were in one of my promo games and there were constant animation lags for us. For example, I'd hit Q and then 2 seconds later I'd see it show up. When a team fight would start everyone would pause and then jump around as if it was ping lag, but my ping did not move from 59 so it didn't seem like it was a ping related issue, which is why I'm calling it "animation lags". So I decided to reset my client to see if that'd work and now I can't even log into it (Lost the promo game because of it obviously). It stays on the "authenticating" phase and doesn't move. Any ideas what this is?

replies.body:
Hi Porocles,

I am also experiencing a lot of lag. I am using Rogers up in Canada, and I have 150-200ms in-game when I usually have 20-30ms.

If I try to traceroute to a NA Riot IP, I get this:

Tracing route to 104.160.131.3 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  192.168.1.1
  2    17 ms    12 ms    17 ms  99.238.160.1
  3    13 ms    11 ms    14 ms  67.231.221.169
  4    12 ms     7 ms    10 ms  209.148.232.69
  5    16 ms    15 ms    14 ms  209.148.232.61
  6    13 ms    15 ms    15 ms  209.148.230.234
  7    22 ms    26 ms    36 ms  209.148.230.134
  8   158 ms   140 ms   147 ms  eqix-ch2.chi01.riotdirect.net [206.223.119.235]
  9   171 ms   175 ms   158 ms  104.160.131.3

The last hop before Riot, 209.148.230.134, seems to be a Rogers IP. Something wrong with their pairing to Riot?

Edit: It seems to be slowly improving, now around 100ms. Hopefully it goes back to normal soon :)

Hey, thanks for these logs!  Something definitely looks odd reaching riot direct.  There could be a peering issue with your ISP getting to the game server, so I recommend calling them to see what's up.  If you like, you can also hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and our tech team could help get some logs to send over to them as well.  Hope that helps!
Anyone have an idea how to fix this. Since everyone who is having trouble is directly connected to rogers. Should we call rogers and find out or contact riot to find out what is going on?
Rogers here as well. ping is around 150 higher than normal.
I guess its just the ISP? I'm also on rogers, and having some high ping :/
Yeah I'm with Rogers aswell and the ping is so bad <200ms

Even though your connection works fine for other things, you can have specific issues reaching specific services like the game server.  Specifically, this sounds like you've got some packet loss that's degraded to a total inability to connect.  It sucks that this cost a promo, and I want to help!  You guys should both go through each step of the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help fix this up.  You can also use the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to auto-configure your firewall settings.

This should help get you back in.  Test it out in a custom game so you don't get any penalties, and let me know if it helps.
